mandatory: The TRDP layer shall provide services for process data and message data communication.

Mandatory: shall be used for all TRDP data on the wire
Process data exchange shall support the following push communication pattern
The ComId shall be set to zero (ComId = 0) in the following cases: for PDUs with unspecified user dataset
Prohibited: The ComIds 1..999 shall not be used by the application since they are reserved for specific purposes

Mandatory: The TRDP layer shall provide a service for process data communication to the TRDP user
pattern configured communication pattern for the PD-PDU exchange
Check the locally stored topology counters submitted with the publish

Train Real-Time Data Protocol (TRDP) ->.data:
{
    "applies when values are equal": "Case 3 applies when values are equal",
    "applies when any value equals 0": "Case 5 applies when any value equals 0",
    "applies when any value equals 0": "Case 0 applies when any value equals 0",
    "is set to 0": "topography counter value is set to 0",
    "applies only for": "Case applies only for subscriber comparing topography counter values of the received telegram with locally stored values"
}

Mandatory: The service primitives for redundancy handling shall be used in the same way by the publisher and subscriber
If a redundant function enters the redundancy leader state, it shall call PD.setRed(LEADER) for all relevant process data
If a redundant function enters the redundancy follower state, it shall call PD.setRed(!LEADER) for all relevant process data
When starting TRDP, publishers of redundant process data (identified by a ComId marked as redundant) shall initialize the redundancy handling

Train Real-Time Data Protocol (TRDP) ->.data:
{
    "shall be given to the TRDP layer": "SHALL",
    "shall send out the data only after checking the locally stored topography counters": "SHALL",
    "Timeout supervision at subscriber TRDP layer shall be started after subscription": "SHALL",
    "Timeout supervision at subscriber TRDP layer shall be restarted after receiving the related process data": "SHALL",
    "shall check the topography counters of the received telegram": "SHALL",
    "the data shall be marked as invalid": "SHALL"
}

{
    "shall be given to the TRDP layer": "Mandatory",
    "shall subscribe for requests": "Mandatory",
    "shall be checked": "Mandatory",
    "shall be responded to": "Mandatory",
    "needs to subscribe for replies": "Mandatory",
    "shall be restarted": "Mandatory",
    "shall check": "Mandatory"
}

Mandatory: A publisher shall publish PD-PDU(data) when: the defined time cycle terminates (push pattern, TRDP triggered cycle)
the publisher shall publish PD-PDU(data) when: the publisher receives an application request to send the data immediately (push pattern, application triggered)
the publisher shall publish PD-PDU(data) when: the publisher receives a request from a dedicated subscriber or an independent communication entity
the publisher of TRDP triggered pushed PD-PDU shall apply a rate limitation
the related reply is handled according to the protocol specifications
Prohibited: Sending application triggered cyclic PD-PDUs shall be restricted
Not Recommended: Sending application triggered cyclic PD-PDUs shall be restricted since there is no possibility to include rate control

Mandatory: Message data exchange shall support the following push communication pattern
Message data exchange shall support the following pull communication pattern as defined in point a) point to point, sporadic with acknowledge, sink knows the source
Shall be managed for sending process telegrams
shall be managed (stored) for received process telegrams
shall be incremented with each sending of the process telegram
Shall be used for communication layer surveillance to verify that the application is still updating its process data
Shall be set by the user
Shall be used for train addressing as defined in IEC 61375-2-3
Shall be set when the source device uses the operational train directory
Shall be set to 0 (invalid) if not used
Shall be the primary information about the user data
Shall be used only in a PD request
the reply shall be sent as an unspecified PDU
A caller shall use an IP unicast address or an IP multicast address for addressing known repliers
A caller shall use an IP multicast address for addressing unknown repliers
A replier shall respond to the caller's unicast address
A caller shall be able to define by the request type whether a reply is expected or not
A replier shall be able to define by the reply type whether a confirmation of its reply is expected
three message data transfer options shall be provided by TRDP
is set to 0 if unknown (error return)
When mdAbort is FALSE, the system continues processing
When mdAbort is TRUE, the system aborts the session
If the sequence counter of the previous received request is invalid, discardMsg discards the received message

Train Real-Time Data Protocol (TRDP) ->.data:
{
    "must match at least one of the cases listed in Table A.21": "Mandatory",
    "enters StateWaitForReply when sendType equals Mn": "Mandatory",
    "leaves when missingReplies equals 0 AND missingConfirms equals 0": "Mandatory",
    "restarts with mdHandleCallerTimeout when maxTimeoutCnt does not equal 0": "Mandatory",
    "otherwise processes meReceived to closeCallSession": "Mandatory"
}

Mandatory: existsReplySession - The reply session for a given session id exists
existsListener - A listener for the given request with fitting topography counters exists
stateReplySession(sessionId) - Replier session state for a given session id including protocol type, length and topography counter
checkTopoCounts - Check the topography counters of the received message against 4211

Train Real-Time Data Protocol (TRDP) ->.data:
{
    "shall be received": "An empty destinationUri in MD telegrams shall be received by a listener regardless of any defined destinationUri.",
    "has no special meaning": "An empty sourceUri in MD telegrams has no special meaning.",
    "shall receive": "A listener shall receive MD telegrams regardless of any defined destinationUri in the MD telegram.",
    "means that": "An empty sourceUri filter entry in the MD.addListener service primitive means that the listener accepts telegrams from any source.",
    "shall have": "Any two listeners shall have a disjunctive set of filter parameters: comId, sourceUri, and destinationUri.",
    "may be received": "MD telegrams with empty destinationUri may be received by several listeners with different filter parameters."
}

Conditional constraints: If the message type does not match any of these
If the message type is Me and exists equals TRUE

Mandatory: The sequence counter shall be incremented with each repetition and shall be returned with the reply message
The protocol version shall consist of fixed values for incompatible changes and compatible changes
The topography counter shall be set by the user if not used
The topography counter shall be set when the source device uses information from the operational train
The status value shall be set by the replier to report the status
The session identification shall identify a request-error session
shall be computed at caller side and reused at replier side
shall be used at caller side to relate a reply or error
shall be used at replier side to identify a session
shall be a UUID according to RFC 4122, time-based
The reply timeout value shall be set to define the expected timeout
The header frame check sequence computed according to specification
